intro: Gongora truncata var. leucochila, commonly known as the white-lipped nightshade, is a species of flowering plant native to the Andean regions of South America. It belongs to the Solanaceae family, which includes nightshades, and is characterized by its striking, showy flowers. The plant features heart-shaped leaves with a velvety texture and produces small, bell-shaped flowers that are typically white or pale pink. It thrives in cool, humid environments and is often found in cloud forests. Due to its ornamental value, it is cultivated in botanical gardens and by enthusiasts interested in rare and exotic plants.
